*single_crochet 4 decrease repeat from * 3x 15 sts round 27 *single_crochet 3 decrease repeat from * 3x 12 sts finish stuffing rounds 28-30 single_crochet around 12 sts fasten_off and sew closed leaving a long yarn tail hanging fins all of the fins are worked back and forth in row of single_crochet working in the back loop only blo chain 1 for a turning chain at the beginning of each row working your first single_crochet in the same stitch as the turning chain turning chain does not count as a single_crochet the photo above shows all the fins you are about to make next to a completed body © kate wood send comments or suggestions to tinypantswood@gmail com 3 fins make 3 the top fin and the pectoral fins are all worked in the same way the decreases decrease will cause your row slant to one side making the fish s fins diagonally ribbed for the first one leave a tail for sewing at the beginning of your work and weave in your tail at the end this one will be the top fin for the other two leave a yarn tail for sewing after you fasten_off and weave in the other end these will be your pectoral/side fins i have given written instructions as well as a chart even if you don t use the chart it can be helpful to visualize what you re making see assembly instructions below for how to sew them on to your fish s body chain 10 working in blo row 1 chain 1 single_crochet 8 decrease turn row 2 chain 1 decrease single_crochet 7 turn row 3 chain 1 single_crochet 6 decrease turn row 4 chain 1 decrease single_crochet 5 turn row 5 chain 1 single_crochet 4 decrease turn row 6 chain 1 decrease single_crochet 3 fasten_off tail fin make 2 for a true fantail goldfish you need to make two of these if you want a less fancy fish you can go ahead and just make one but if you ve got two it s much easier to prop up and pose your fish and i promise these aren t as scary or complicated as they might look at first i have given written instructions for these below as well as a chart on the next page the tail fins are worked similarly to a chevron afghan the pairs of decreases decrease at the center of each row will make your work form a v shape giving the fish s tail its shape chain 32
